intro: Struthiola bachmanniana, commonly known as the Bachmann's struthiola, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
